meanings.definition: To undergo combustion or be consumed by fire.
meanings.sent1: The wood will burn in the campfire.
meanings.sent2: The candles burn brightly in the dark room.
meanings.sent3: Don't touch the stove, or you'll burn your hand!
meanings.sent4: Her passion for music burns like a fierce flame.
meanings.sent5: The forest fire burned uncontrollably, destroying everything in its path.

meanings.sent1: She will burn the old papers in the fireplace.
meanings.sent2: The arsonist intended to burn down the building.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally let the cookies burn in the oven.
meanings.sent4: His words burned with anger as he shouted at them.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays burn the skin if you stay out too long without protection.

meanings.definition: To damage or injure by fire or heat.
meanings.sent1: The hot iron can burn your clothes if left too long.
meanings.sent2: The wildfire can burn down entire forests.
meanings.sent3: She learned the hard way that curling irons can burn hair.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal felt like a burn on his heart.
meanings.sent5: The scalding water can burn your skin if you're not careful.

meanings.definition: To feel or suffer from a sensation of heat.
meanings.sent1: The sunburn makes her skin burn and peel.
meanings.sent2: After running, his lungs burn from the effort.
meanings.sent3: The spicy chili made his mouth burn with heat.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks burned with embarrassment when she tripped.
meanings.sent5: The intense workout made his muscles burn with fatigue.

meanings.sent1: If you stay out too long, you will burn in the sun.
meanings.sent2: She forgot to apply sunscreen and now her shoulders burn.
meanings.sent3: His nose always burns first when he forgets his hat.
meanings.sent4: The fair-skinned child easily burns in the summer heat.
meanings.sent5: The tourists' skin started to burn after hours on the beach.
